title: 103_hr58
content: The Act titled "Merchant Marine Memorial Enhancement Act of 1993" includes provisions for the conveyance of vessels. The Secretary of Transportation has the authority to convey 2 vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to a nonprofit organization that maintains a Liberty Ship or Victory Ship memorial. The vessels must be at least 4,000 displacement tons, have no usefulness to the Government, and be scheduled for scrapping. Before conveying vessels to a nonprofit organization for memorial purposes, the Secretary of Transportation must ensure that the organization agrees to sell the vessel for scrap and use the proceeds to refurbish a Liberty Ship or Victory Ship for commemorative activities in 1994. The Secretary of Transportation must ensure that a nonprofit organization agrees to sell a vessel for scrap and use the proceeds to refurbish a Liberty Ship or Victory Ship for commemorative activities. Any proceeds not used as specified must be returned to the United States and deposited in the Vessel Operations Revolving Fund. Vessels conveyed under this section must be delivered at their current location. The Secretary can convey vessels located at their current location, in their current condition, without cost to the Government. This authority expires 2 years after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. DOCUMENTATION OF VESSELS. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for specific vessels, including ABORIGINAL, AFTERSAIL, ALEXANDRIA, AMANDA, ARBITRAGE II, and ARIEL. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for vessels such as BRANDARIS, COMPASS ROSE, DIXIE, ELISSA, EMERALD PRINCESS, ENTERPRISE, EUROPA STAR, EUROPA SUN, and GAZELA OF PHILADELPHIA. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels like GRAY, GRIZZLY PROCESSOR, GUSTO, GYPSY COWBOY, IMPATIENT LADY, ISLAND GIRL, JULIET, KALENA, and LAURISA. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels like LAURISA, LIBBY ROSE, LISERON, MARINE STAR, MARINER, MARY B, MOONSHINE, MYSTIQUE, NORTHERN LIGHT, PAI NUI, and PANDACEA. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels like PANDACEA, PELICAN, PLAY PRETTY, PRINCE OF TIDES II, RBOAT, SABLE, SERENA, SHILOH, SIDEWINDER, SWELL DANCER, and TESSA. Foreign-flag vessel H851, named WHIT CON TIKI, is permitted to engage in coastwise trade to transport an offshore drilling platform jacket from Texas to Viosca Knoll 989 on the Outer Continental Shelf. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels LADY CHARL II and LINETTE with coastwise and Great Lakes endorsement. The Transportation department can issue a certificate of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for the vessel M/V TWIN DRILL if it undergoes a major conversion in a US shipyard, costing more than 3 times the purchase value before the conversion, completed and documented before June 30, 1995. The Secretary of Transportation may issue a certificate of documentation for a vessel if the person documenting the vessel contracts with a US shipyard to construct an additional vessel of equal or greater capacity within a specified timeframe. The Secretary of Transportation may issue a certificate of documentation with coastwise and fishery endorsements for vessels REEL CLASS and DA WARRIOR. Vessels UST ATLANTIC and UST PACIFIC may be sold to non-US citizens and placed under a foreign registry. The vessel AMY CHOUEST (United States official number 995631) is deemed to be less than 500 gross tons for purposes of the maritime laws of the United States, even if transferred to a foreign registry. The Secretary of Commerce may deploy a Real-Time System in Galveston Bay and the Houston Ship Channel for nautical charting and marine safety improvements. The Secretary of Transportation will establish a 3-year pilot program for Sealift Training at the Massachusetts Maritime Academy. The document is attested by DONNALD K. ANDERSON, with Dallas L. Dendy, Jr. as the Assistant to the Clerk.
